Detailed Description

Abstract interface of a calibration object.

The calibration object returns for a value measured with a certain cell a calibrated value.

Definition at line 9 of file Calibration.hh.

Member Function Documentation

virtual Bool_t Calibration::checkForCalibrationConstantsOfModule ( UInt_t  module_id,
UInt_t  module_type,
UInt_t  n_cells 
) const [pure virtual]

Verify that calibration constants exist for a certain module.

Parameters:
module_id id Or serial number of a module which uniquely identifies a detector module of a certain type.
module_type the type of the detector module
n_cells the number of cells on this module. Return true if calibration constants exist for the given module and the number of cells matches the number of calibration constants.

Implemented in ConstantCalibration, and NoOpCalibration.

Referenced by CALICE::SimpleHitSearch::buildCellParameters().

module_type the type of the detector module
cell_index the cell_index in read order: first the ADC values of the first sample from all chips, then the next sample ...
adc_value the ADC value which should be calibrated.
Returns:
the calibrated value.

Implemented in ConstantCalibration, and NoOpCalibration.

Referenced by CALICE::CalibrateAndApplyThreshold::processEvent().

virtual Int_t Calibration::getMiniumADCForMipThreshold ( Float_t  mip_energy_fraction  )  const [pure virtual]

Get the minimum adc value mips will have for the given energy fraction on all pads.

Parameters:
mip_energy_fraction the energy in mips
Returns:
minimum adc value which is below the given energy on all pads. This method can be used to get the lowest adc value a mip of the given energy fraction will have on all pads. This value is useful to select candidates before actually performing th calibration. This function is intended to be called at the beginning of each event.

Implemented in ConstantCalibration, and NoOpCalibration.

Referenced by CALICE::CalibrateAndApplyThreshold::processEvent(), CALICE::SimpleHitSearch::searchHits(), and CALICE::SimpleHitSearch::searchHitsAndAdjustPedestalsAndNoise().

virtual Bool_t Calibration::isValid ( UInt_t  module_id,
UInt_t  module_type,
UInt_t  cell_index 
) const [inline, virtual]

Return true if a the calibration constants for the given cell are in the allowed range.

Parameters:
module_id id Or serial number of a module which uniquely identifies a detector module of a certain type.
module_type the type of the detector module
cell_index the cell_index in read order: first the ADC values of the first sample from all chips, then the next sample ...
Returns:
true for cells with valid calibration constants, false for cells which should be declared dead.

This method is used to find, after module connection changes, cells which should be declared dead.
